field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this FastCGI application.

field.label: Docroot
field.help: Define the document root on the remote host. It will be used to build the default value of FastCGI parameters SCRIPT_FILENAME and PATH_TRANSLATED. It is a mandatory setting.

field.label: Index
field.help: Define the script name that will be appended after an URI that ends with a slash ("/") to set the default value of the FastCGI parameter SCRIPT_NAME. It is an optional setting.

field.label: Path Info
field.help: Define a regular expression to extract the script-name and the path-info from the URL-decoded path, see HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: STDERR Logging
field.help: Enable logging of STDERR messages reported by the FastCGI application. It is an optional setting. By default STDERR messages are ignored.

field.label: Keep Connection Open
field.help: Instruct the FastCGI application to keep the connection open after sending a response. If disabled, the FastCGI application closes the connection after responding to a request.

field.label: Connection Management
field.help: Enable the retrieval of variables about connection management from the FastCGI application by sending the record FCGI_GET_VALUES on connection establishment. Some FastCGI applications do not support this feature and others close the connection immediately after sending their response. As a result, this option is disabled by default.

field.label: Connection Multiplexing
field.help: Enable the support for connection multiplexing. This option may be overwritten if the variable FCGI_MPXS_CONNS is retrieved during connection establishment.

field.label: Maximum Concurrent Requests
field.help: Define the maximum number of concurrent requests this application will accept. This option may be overwritten if the variable FCGI_MAX_REQS is retrieved during connection establishment. Furthermore, if the application does not support connection multiplexing, this option will be ignored.

field.label: Select Rules
field.help: Choose rules to be included in this FastCGI application. Only FastCGI rules are supported.
